title: The One With All The Poker

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are sitting at a table. Rachel is working.
Monica and Phoebe enter.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, guys.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey... hi, ladies... uh, can I get you anything? (to Monica,

dialogue.speaker: QUIETLY)
dialogue.text: Did you bring the mail?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Lots of responses.

dialogue.speaker: TO MONICA)
dialogue.text: Really? (

dialogue.speaker: OUT LOUD)
dialogue.text: Sure, we have scones left! (

dialogue.speaker: TO MONICA)
dialogue.text: OK, read them to me.

dialogue.speaker: READING)
dialogue.text: Dear Ms. Green, thank you for your inquiry, however... oh... (crumples up letter)

dialogue.speaker: OUT LOUD)
dialogue.text: We have apple cinnamon...

dialogue.speaker: READING)
dialogue.text: OK... Dear Ms. Green... yeah... yeah... yeah... No. (crumpes up letter)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: READING)
dialogue.text: Your Visa bill is huge!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (grabs the bill) Give me that!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, I can't believe you. Linda is so great! Why won't you go out with her again?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Is this still about her whole 'The Flintstones could've really happened' thing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, it's not just that. It's just—I want someone who... who does something for me, y'know? Who gets my heart pounding, who... who makes me, uh... (begins to stare lovingly at Rachel)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...little playthings with yarn?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Could you want her more?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sarcastically) Dee, the sarcastic sister from Whats Happening .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, I am totally, totally over her, OK, I just... (Rachel comes over,

dialogue.speaker: ROSS LAYS HEAD ON TABLE)
dialogue.text: Hiiii!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi! How are you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We're fine, we're fine.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK. (walks away)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Shut up!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We're not—we're not saying anything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uhhhh... Joey cried last night.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to the girls) We were playing poker, alright...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: There was chocolate on the three. It looked like an eight, alright?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, guys, you should've seen him. 'Read 'em and weep.'

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And then he did.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, now, how come you guys have never played poker with us?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, what is that? Like, some kind of guy thing? Like, some kind of sexist guy thing? Like it's poker, so only guys can play?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, women are welcome to play.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, OK, so then what is it? Some kind of... you know, like, like... some kind of, y'know, like... alright, what is it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: There just don't happen to be any women in our games.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, we just don't happen to know any women that know how to play poker.

dialogue.speaker: GIRLS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, please, that is such a lame excuse!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I mean, that's a typical guy response.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Excuse me, do any of you know how to play?

dialogue.speaker: GIRLS
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But you could teach us.

dialogue.speaker: GUYS
dialogue.text: No.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are sitting at a table. Rachel is working.
Monica and Phoebe enter.]

events.event_description: Monica and Phoebe enter Central Perk and greet Ross and Chandler.
Rachel asks Monica if she brought the mail and Monica responds that she received many responses.
Rachel reads a letter from the mail and crumples it up.
Rachel reads a second letter and crumples it up.
Rachel exclaims that her Visa bill is huge and grabs the bill.
Chandler questions Ross about his feelings for Linda and why he won't go out with her again.
Ross admits he wants someone who makes his heart pound and begins to stare lovingly at Rachel.
Ross lays his head on the table and says hi to Rachel.
Joey mentions that he cried last night and thanks Chandler.
Ross asks if any of the women know how to play poker, and Rachel offers to teach them, but the guys refuse.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the guys are teaching the girls how to play poker.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (teaching) OK, so now we draw cards.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So I wouldn't need any, right? Cause I have a straight.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, good for you!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Congratulations!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: OK Phoebs, how many do you want?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: OK, I just need two... the, um, ten of spades and the six of clubs.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No. No, uh, Phoebs? You can't—you can't do...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh wait, I have the ten of spades! Here! (gives it to Phoebe)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no, that's OK, I don't need them. I'm going for fours.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you're... (gives up)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright, here we go. We've got salmon roulettes and assorted crudites.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: OOooooo!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, Monica, what're you doin'? This is a poker game. You can't serve food with more than one syllable. It's gotta be like chips, or dip, or pretz...(look of realization)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (changing subject) OK, so at this point, the dealer...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright, you know, we got it, we got it. Let's play for real. High stakes... big bucks...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright, now, you sure? Phoebe just threw away two jacks because they didn't look happy...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But... I'm ready, so, just deal.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: OK, alright, last minute lesson, last minute lesson. (holds up two cards) Joey... three... eight. Eight... three. (Joey is unamused) Alright babe, deal the cards.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (throws down her cards) Dammit, dammit, dammit!

dialogue.speaker: TO JOEY)
dialogue.text: Oh I see, so then, you were lying.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: About how good your cards were.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Heh... I was bluffing .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: A-ha! And... what is bluffing? Is it not another word for... lying?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK, sorry to break up this party, but I've got resumes to fax before work tomorrow... (gets up to leave)

dialogue.speaker: GUYS
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Rach, Rach, we gotta settle.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Settle what?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The... Jamestown colony of Virginia. You see, King George is giving us the land, so...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The game, Rachel, the game. You owe us money for the game.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. Right.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You know what, you guys? It's their first time, why don't we just forget about the money, alright?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hell no, we'll pay!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: OK, Monica? I had another answer all ready.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And you know what? We want a rematch.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well that's fine with me. Could use the money.

dialogue.speaker: TO ROSS)
dialogue.text: So basically, you get your ya-yas by taking money from all of your friends.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (pause)...Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, and I get my ya-yas from Ikea . You have to put them together yourself, but they cost a little less.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, Rachel, this is poker. I play to win, alright? In order for me to win, other people have to lose. So if you're gonna play poker with me, don't expect me to be a 'nice guy,' OK? Cause once those cards are dealt... (claps hands three times)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (pause)...Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm not a nice guy.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the guys are teaching the girls how to play poker.]

events.event_description: Chandler begins teaching the girls how to draw cards in poker.
Monica asks if she needs any cards because she has a straight.
Rachel congratulates Monica on having a straight.
Phoebe asks for two specific cards: ten of spades and six of clubs.
Rachel offers Phoebe the ten of spades, then decides she doesn't need it.
Rachel states she is going for fours, indicating her intended hand.
Joey comments on serving food with only one syllable words during the poker game.
Monica declares they are playing for real with high stakes.
Phoebe accuses Joey of lying about his cards after he throws down his hand.
Ross explains to Rachel that he plays poker to win, implying others must lose.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Ross' apartment. Chandler and Joey are there. Ross enters with a pizza.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright boys, let's eat.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, did you get that from the 'I Love Rachel' pizzeria?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You still on that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, come on. What was with that whole Black Bart speech? (

dialogue.speaker: MIMICKING)
dialogue.text: "When I play poker, I'm not a nice guy!"

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You are way off, pal.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, I don't think so, see Ross, because I think you love her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Um.... no. See, I might've had feelings for her at one time—not any more. I just—I...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel! Where are you going with that disc?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You are not putting that on again! Marcel, OK—if you press that button, you are in very, very big trouble.

scenes.location: Ross' apartment. Chandler and Joey are there. Ross enters with a pizza.
scenes.event_description: [Scene: Ross' apartment. Chandler and Joey are there. Ross enters with a pizza.]

events.event_description: Ross enters the apartment carrying a pizza.
Ross says, 'Alright boys, let's eat.'
Chandler questions if Ross got the pizza from the 'I Love Rachel' pizzeria.
Ross responds to Chandler's question about the pizzeria.
Chandler mimics Black Bart's speech, joking about poker behavior.
Ross dismisses Chandler's impression, indicating he's off the mark.
Joey states that Ross loves Rachel.
Ross denies loving Rachel and claims he had feelings for her in the past but no longer does.
Ross calls out to Marcel, asking where he is going with a disc.
Ross warns Marcel not to press the button on the disc, threatening trouble if he does.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe are there.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (opening mail) Can you believe what a jerk Ross was being?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know. He can get really competitive.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ha. Ha, ha.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, hello, kettle? This is Monica. You're black.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Please! I am not as bad as Ross.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I beg to differ. The Pictionary incident?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That was not an incident! I-I was gesturing, a-and the plate slipped out of my hand.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ooo

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're kidding! Where? Where?

dialogue.speaker: IN DISBELIEF)
dialogue.text: Sak's... Fifth... Avenue.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, Rachel!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's like the mother ship is calling you home.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, what's the job?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Assistant buyer. Oh! I would be shopping... for a living!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: OK, look. That is Aunt Iris. This woman has been playing poker since she was five. You gotta listen to every word she says. (opens door) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: AUNT IRIS
dialogue.text: Is Tony Randall dead?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't think so.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: AUNT IRIS
dialogue.text: Well, he may be now, because I think I hit him with my car.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: AUNT IRIS
dialogue.text: No! That's bluffing. Lesson number one. (walks into kitchen) Let me tell you something... everything you hear at a poker

dialogue.speaker: GAME IS PURE CRAP. (TO PHOEBE)
dialogue.text: Nice earrings.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thank y... (thinks about it)

dialogue.speaker: AUNT IRIS
dialogue.text: Girls, sit down.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, Aunt Iris? This is Phoebe, and that's Rachel...

dialogue.speaker: AUNT IRIS
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, listen, I am parked at a meter. Let's do it.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe are there.]

events.event_description: Rachel opens her mail and comments on Ross's behavior.
Monica agrees that Ross can be competitive.
Phoebe makes a humorous remark, laughing.
Monica questions Phoebe about her comment.
Phoebe sarcastically addresses the kettle, implying it is black.
Rachel recalls the Pictionary incident involving Monica.
Rachel excitedly announces her new job as assistant buyer.
Monica introduces Aunt Iris and emphasizes her poker-playing background.
Aunt Iris asks if Tony Randall is dead, implying a joke about hitting him with her car.
Aunt Iris dismisses the idea of hitting Tony Randall with her car as bluffing and criticizes poker game talk.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross's apartment, everyone but Rachel is seated around his table. The Lion
Sleep Tonight plays in the background.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ross, could we please, please, please listen to anything else?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm gonna pay for that tonight.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Guys! Guess what, guess what, guess what, guess what!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Um, ok... the... the fifth dentist caved and now they're all recommending Trident ?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noooo... the interview! She loved me! She absolutely loved me. We talked for like two and a half hours, we have the same taste in clothes, and—oh, I went to camp with her cousin... And, oh, the job is perfect. I can do this. I can do this well!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: That's great! That's wonderful!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, oh, and then she told the funniest story...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: OK, great. You'll tell us and we'll laugh. Let's play poker.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright now listen, you guys, we talked about it, and if you don't want to play, we completely understand.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yes, yes, we could play some other game... like, uh, I don't know... Pictionary ?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ha, ha, very funny, very funny. But I think we'd like to give poker another try. Shall we, ladies?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, we should. I think we should.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, Rach, do you want me to shuffle those?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, no, thats OK. Y'know, I think I'm gonna give it a go.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Alright... (shuffles cards expertly, all the guys stare in amazement)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Ross's apartment, everyone but Rachel is seated around his table. The Lion
Sleep Tonight plays in the background.]

events.event_description: Rachel excitedly announces she had a successful interview and believes she is perfect for the job.
Chandler suggests playing Pictionary instead of poker.
Monica insists on playing poker again and asks the ladies if they agree.
Ross offers to shuffle the cards for Rachel.
Rachel expertly shuffles the cards, impressing the group.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, Phoebs owes $7.50, Monica, you owe $10, and Rachel, you owe fifteen big ones.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But hey, thanks for teachin' us Cross-Eyed Mary. You guys, we gotta play that at our regular game.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Alright, here's my $7.50. (Hands them the money) But I think you should know that this money is cursed.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I cursed it. So now bad things will happen to he who spends it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's alright, I'll take it. Bad things happen to me anyway. This way I can break 'em up with a movie.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, that just leaves the big Green poker machine, who owes fifteen...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mmm-hmmm. Oh, so typical. Ooo, I'm a man. Ooo, I have a penis. Ooo, I have to win money to exert my power over women. (hands over her money)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know what? This is not over. We will play you again, and we will win, and you will lose, and you will beg, and we will laugh, and we will take every last dime you have, and you will hate yourselves forever .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hmm. Kinda stepped on my point there, Mon.

events.event_description: Ross announces the amounts owed by Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel during a group gathering in Ross's apartment.
Phoebe hands over $7.50 to the group and claims the money is cursed.
Phoebe states that she cursed the money, implying bad things will happen to whoever spends it.
Chandler accepts the cursed money, joking about bad things happening to him and breaking up with a movie.
Ross mentions the remaining debt owed by the big Green poker machine.
Rachel hands over her money, making a sarcastic comment about her desire to exert power over women.
Monica declares that they will play the game again, intending to win back their money and humiliate the others.
Rachel comments on Monica's aggressive declaration, implying she interrupted her point.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there ready for another poker game.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, you gals wanna hand over your money now? That way, we don't have to go through the formality of actually playing.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ooooh, that's fine. We'll see who has the last laugh there, monkey boy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: OK, we done with the chit-chat? Are we ready to play some serious poker?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (holding a card and waving it in front of her face) Hey you guys, look, the one-eyed jack follows me wherever I go. (they look at her) Right, OK, serious poker.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Excuse me, where are you going?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh... to the bathroom.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you want to go to the bathroom, or do you wanna play poker?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I want to go to the bathroom. (exits)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright, well, I'm gonna order a pizza. (gets up)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh no-no-no-no-no, I'm still waiting to hear from that job and the store closes at nine, so you can eat then.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That's fine. I'll just have a Tic-Tac to hold me over.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright, Cincinnati, no blinds, everybody ante. (deals cards)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (looks at her cards) Yes! (everyone looks at her) .... or no.

dialogue.speaker: ALRIGHT. (TO RACHEL)
dialogue.text: Your money's mine, Green.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Your fly is open, Geller. (he checks it, and zips up)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You guys, you know what I just realized? 'Joker' is 'poker' with a 'J.' Coincidence?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, that's... that's 'joincidence' with a 'C'!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh... Phoebe? Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Um... I'm out. (throws in cards)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm in.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Me too.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Me too. Alright, whattaya got.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, you better hop outta the shower, cause... I gotta flush. (lays down cards)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, well, well, hop back in bucko, cause I got four sixes! (lays down cards) I won! I actually won! Oh my God! Y'know what? (collects chips) I think I'm gonna make a little Ross pile. (holds up a chip) I think that one was Ross's, and I think—oh—that one was Ross's. Yes! (

dialogue.speaker: STARTS SINGING)
dialogue.text: Well, I have got your money, and you'll never see it ...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And your fly's still open...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ha, I made you look....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I couldn't be inner. Monica?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica, in or out?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (slams down cards) I hate this game!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: OK Joey, your bet.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ahhh, I fold like a cheap hooker who got hit in the stomach by a fat guy with sores on his face. (the girls look at him, confused) Oh, I'm out.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I am very in.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Couldn't be more out. (throws in cards)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Me too. Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, I will see you... and I'll raise you. (throws chips in pot) What do you say... want to waste another buck?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, not this time. (he folds) So... what'd you have?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm not telling. (collects chips)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on, show them to me. (reaches for her cards, Rachel covers them up)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No..!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Show them to me!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Get your hands out of there! No!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Let me see! Show them!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I've had dates like this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (deals new hand) Boy, you really can't stand to lose, can you? Your whole face is getting red... little veins popping out on your temple...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Plus that shirt doesn't really match those pants.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: First of all, I'm not losing...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, you are losing. Definitely losing. (phone rings)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Let's not talk about losing. Just deal the...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (answering phone) Hel-lo, Rachel Green.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (mimicking Rachel) Mee mee, mee-mee mee.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Excuse me. (covers up phone; to Ross) It's about the job .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Barbara! Hi, how are you? (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) No, I understand. Yeah. Oh, oh, come on, no, I'm fine. Don't be silly. Yeah... oh, but you know, if-if anything else opens up, plea—Hello? Hello? (hangs up phone, very depressed)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sorry, Rach.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know, there's gonna be lots of other stuff.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah...(sigh)....OK. Where were we? Oh, OK... five card draw, uh... jacks or better... nothing wild, everybody ante.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, Rachel, we don't have to do this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, we do. (pause)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright, check.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Check.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm in for fifty cents. (throws it in)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Call.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm in.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I see your fifty cents... and I raise you... five dollars. (throws it in)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I thought, uh... it was a fifty cent limit.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I just lost a job, and I'd like to raise the bet five bucks. Does anybody have a problem with that?

dialogue.speaker: TO ROSS)
dialogue.text: Loser?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I fold. (lays cards down, and gets up)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What do you mean, you fold? Hey, come on! What is this? I thought that 'once the cards were dealt, I'm not a nice guy.' I mean, what, were you just full of it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm in. (throws in chips)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How many you want?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: One. (Rachel gives him the card.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Dealer takes two. (she deals herself two cards) What do you bet?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I bet two dollars. (throws it in)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK... see your two... and I raise you twenty. (throws it in)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I see your twenty, raise you twenty-five. (throws it in)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: See your twenty-five...and...uh, Monica, get my purse.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel, there's nothing in it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK, then get me your purse.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: OK, here you go. Good luck.

dialogue.speaker: THANK YOU. (TO ROSS)
dialogue.text: I saw your twenty-five, and I raise you... seven.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ...teen! (throws in a ten-dollar bill)

dialogue.speaker: TO JOEY)
dialogue.text: Joey, I'm a little shy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That's OK, Ross, you can ask me. What?

dialogue.speaker: TO ROSS)
dialogue.text: What do you need, what do you need?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fifteen.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, here's ten. (gives it to him)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Here, I got five, I got five. (Ross takes the money)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Good luck.

dialogue.speaker: TO RACHEL)
dialogue.text: OK, I am calling your seventeen. What do you got?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (lays down cards) Full house.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You got me.

dialogue.speaker: TO ROSS)
dialogue.text: Ahhh, that's alright. Y'know, that's a tough hand to beat.

dialogue.speaker: TO ROSS)
dialogue.text: I thought we had them!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, well, when you don't have the cards, you don't have the cards, you know. (looks at Rachel) But, uh... look how happy she is. (smiles)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there ready for another poker game.]

events.event_description: Ross suggests that Rachel and Monica hand over their money to avoid playing the poker game.
Rachel responds defiantly to Ross's suggestion, implying they will have the last laugh.
Monica asks if they are ready to play poker, indicating the start of the game.
Phoebe shows her cards and makes a joke about the one-eyed jack following her, then prepares to play serious poker.
Ross leaves the game to go to the bathroom.
Joey announces he is going to order a pizza.
Monica deals the cards to the players, initiating the poker hand.
Rachel wins the hand with four sixes and begins collecting chips, singing about having Rachel's money.
Rachel and Monica decide to play five-card draw poker, with Rachel raising the bet significantly.
Rachel wins the final hand with a full house, and Ross acknowledges her victory.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, all six are playing Pictionary at Monica's
apartment. Monica is drawing a picture, and the three guys are guessing. She draws what
looks like an airplane.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Airplane ! Airport ! Airport '75 ! Airport '77 ! Airport '79 !

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, time's up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (pointing at the drawing, upset) Bye... bye... BIRDIE .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That's a bird?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That's a bird !

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK, OK, it's my turn. (reads the answer)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Go.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh.... bean! Bean!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (triumphantly) The Unbearable Likeness of Being !

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That , you get? That , you get?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, all six are playing Pictionary at Monica's
apartment. Monica is drawing a picture, and the three guys are guessing. She draws what
looks like an airplane.]

events.event_description: Monica begins drawing a picture of an airplane on the Pictionary game board.
Chandler guesses 'Airplane' as the drawing, followed by multiple incorrect guesses including 'Airport' and 'Airport '75'.
Rachel announces that time is up for the current round.
Monica points at her drawing and exclaims 'Bye... bye... BIRDIE', indicating her guess of the drawing.
Phoebe asks if the drawing is a bird, confirming her interpretation of Monica's guess.
Rachel states that she is taking her turn and reads the answer aloud.
Rachel guesses 'Bean' as her answer to the drawing.
Joey triumphantly guesses 'The Unbearable Likeness of Being' as the answer, indicating he has guessed correctly.
Rachel confirms that Joey's answer is correct.
Monica asks if Joey's answer is correct, expressing her curiosity about the outcome.
